attributes.action: David Cameron to implement artical 50 before he resigns.
attributes.additional_details:
48 hours before the referendum David Cameron said he would stay priminister what ever the voice of the British people voted for. 
He has gone back on his word and resigned. He should be the priminister to implement artical 50 without delay and set up a Brexit committee to include those involved in the 'vote out' committee.
attributes.background:
David Cameron promised the British people a referendum to which the people have now voted to leave the EU. 
We must urge David Cameron to follow through on the referendum result without delay before his resignation date. 
David Cameron must finish what he started and not leave for others.
